<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 8+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Oil of Object Animation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=716)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Oil" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=121" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 258 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Two Actions" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This fine golden oil comes in a small blue canister. Carefully spreading the oil over an object turns it into an [animated object](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=4) of the same type. For example, sprinkling it on a statue makes an [animated statue](/Monsters.aspx?ID=20). If the animated object's level would be greater than 3, the oil struggles to animate it and ultimately fails.

 This animated object has the [minion](/Traits.aspx?ID=109) trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you Command it. You can issue a Command for the current turn as part of the activation. The object remains animated for 1 minute before falling inert. As usual, you can have a maximum of four minions under your control.
